title: Getting Rid of Fraction Denominators
text: What is the LCD (largest common denominator) of $$\frac{1}{4}$$, $$\frac{1}{2}$$, and $$\frac{5}{8}$$?

title: Getting Rid of Fraction Denominators
text: We must now multiply both sides of the equation by 8 and use the distributive property. We now have $$8\frac{1}{4} x+8\frac{1}{2}=\frac{8\times5}{8}$$. This simplifies to $$2x+4=5$$

title: Solving the New Equation
text: We must now isolate the \"x\" term in the equation to solve.

title: Solving the New Equation
text: To solve for the \"x\" term, we must add subtract 4 from both sides of the equation. We now have $$2x=1$$.

title: Solving the New Equation
text: Now, we can divide both sides by 2. We now have $$x=\frac{1}{2}$$.
